name: ACT
description: Acceptance and Commitment Therapy (ACT) is a type of cognitive-behavioral therapy that focuses on developing psychological flexibility and values-based living. These cards offer practical exercises to develop mindfulness, acceptance, and commitment to personal values.

cards.title: Values vs Goals
cards.description: Distinguish between values and goals
cards.instructions: List ongoing values and specific goals for each life domain

cards.title: Life Compass
cards.description: Map values across key life domains
cards.instructions: Rate importance and current living in each value domain

cards.title: Eulogy Exercise
cards.description: Envision desired legacy and core values
cards.instructions: Write your ideal eulogy focusing on what truly mattered

cards.title: Values Barriers
cards.description: Identify obstacles to values-based living
cards.instructions: List internal/external barriers for each valued direction

cards.title: Role Models
cards.description: Explore values through admired others
cards.instructions: Identify role models and their embodied values

cards.title: Peak Experiences
cards.description: Extract values from meaningful life moments
cards.instructions: Analyze peak experiences for underlying values

cards.title: Values in Action
cards.description: Plan concrete values-aligned behaviors
cards.instructions: Choose three specific actions that express your values

cards.title: Childhood Dreams
cards.description: Connect with early values and aspirations
cards.instructions: Explore childhood dreams for enduring values

cards.title: Values Cards
cards.description: Sort and prioritize personal values
cards.instructions: Rank provided value cards by personal importance

cards.title: Values Conflicts
cards.description: Navigate competing values
cards.instructions: Identify and resolve conflicts between different values

cards.title: SMART Goals
cards.description: Create specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, time-bound goals
cards.instructions: Set one SMART goal aligned with chosen value

cards.title: Stepping Stones
cards.description: Break larger commitments into manageable steps
cards.instructions: Create action sequence from smallest to largest step

cards.title: Obstacle Planning
cards.description: Anticipate and prepare for barriers to action
cards.instructions: List potential obstacles and specific countermeasures

cards.title: Success Tracking
cards.description: Monitor progress on committed actions
cards.instructions: Record completed actions and their outcomes

cards.title: Willingness Scale
cards.description: Rate readiness to take action despite discomfort
cards.instructions: Scale willingness 0-10 and identify next workable step

cards.title: Action Contracts
cards.description: Create formal commitment to value-based actions
cards.instructions: Write specific action contract with accountability plan

cards.title: Pattern Breaking
cards.description: Identify and modify avoidance patterns
cards.instructions: Choose one pattern to change through committed action

cards.title: Mindful Action
cards.description: Practice present-focused engagement in activities
cards.instructions: Complete routine task with full mindful attention

cards.title: Values Integration
cards.description: Connect daily actions to larger values
cards.instructions: Link three daily activities to core values

cards.title: Flexible Planning
cards.description: Develop adaptable action strategies
cards.instructions: Create primary and backup plans for valued action

cards.title: Reinforcement Planning
cards.description: Set up support systems for sustained action
cards.instructions: Design environment and rewards to support commitments

cards.title: Progress Review
cards.description: Evaluate and adjust action plans
cards.instructions: Review recent actions and modify future plans

cards.title: Social Support
cards.description: Engage others in supporting committed action
cards.instructions: Identify and request specific support from others

cards.title: Recovery Plan
cards.description: Develop strategies for getting back on track
cards.instructions: Create plan for recovering from setbacks

cards.title: Impact Assessment
cards.description: Evaluate effects of committed actions
cards.instructions: Analyze how actions affect self and others
